input: Which article provides that any law passed in violation of fundamental rights is void to the extent of such violation
explanation: Article 13 provides that any law passed in violation of fundamental rights is void to the extent of such violation. The State shall not make any law which takes away or abridges the rights conferred by this part and any law made in contravention of this clause shall, to the extent of the contravention, be void. Article 12 is about definition of Fundamental rights.
